meanings.definition: The front part of a house.
meanings.sent1: The housefront had a beautiful garden in front of it.
meanings.sent2: I painted the housefront a bright shade of blue.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel climbed up the housefront and peeked through the window.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a welcoming housefront, always bright and inviting.
meanings.sent5: The housefront stood tall, proud, and strong against the elements.

meanings.definition: The exterior facing of a house.
meanings.sent1: The housefront was made of red bricks.
meanings.sent2: The ivy covered the entire housefront, giving it a charming look.
meanings.sent3: The birds built a nest on the housefront, right above the door.
meanings.sent4: His expression was like a closed housefront, giving away nothing of what was inside.
meanings.sent5: The storm battered against the housefront, but it stood firm and protected the family inside.
